lines.content: * Loads the task list from the file where it is saved.
* In this case the save file is data/data.txt.
* @param taskList Task list where the tasks from the file are saved.
* @throws Elseption If something goes wrong while reading the file.
public void loadFromFile(TaskList taskList) throws Elseption {
* Writes task list to a save file.
* In this case the save file is data/data.txt.
* @param taskList Task list to be written to the save file.
* @throws Elseption If something goes wrong while writing to file.
public void writeToFile(TaskList taskList) throws Elseption {
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task Task to be added to the task list.
* Returns task at the index specified in the parameter.
* @param index Index of the task to be returned.
* @return Task at the index of the task list.
* @throws Elseption If an index that is out of bounds of the task list is given.
public Task getTask(int index) throws Elseption {
* Returns size of the task list
* Returns a boolean that represents whether the task list is empty.
* Marks a task in the task list as done.
* @param index Index of task to be marked as done.
* @return Boolean representing success or failure in marking.
* @throws Elseption If getTask throws an Elseption.
public boolean markTaskAsDone(int index) throws Elseption {
* Unmarks a task in the task list as undone.
* @param index Index of task to be unmarked as undone.
* @return Boolean representing success or failure in unmarking.
* @throws Elseption If getTask throws an Elseption.
public boolean unmarkTaskAsUndone(int index) throws Elseption {
* Deletes a task from the task list.
* @param index Index of task to be deleted.
* @return Boolean representing success or failure in deletion.
* @throws Elseption If the index is out of bounds of the task list.
public Task deleteTask(int index) throws Elseption {
* Returns a string representation of the task list for the user to view.
returnStr.append("    No tasks to do? that's pretty goooood.");
returnStr.append("    So here's the tasks in your list, you should proooobably do them\n");
* Returns a string representation of the task list formatted for writing to the save file.
* Ui class that handles sending messages to interact with the user.
* @param list Task list from which to print tasks.
* Prints a line that looks pretty.
* Prints a message to bid the user goodbye.
* Prints an error message when a command that is not allowed is given.
System.out.println("    Could you, like, write a sensible command please? \n");
* Prints an error message when there is an error writing to the save file.
System.out.println("    there hath been a failure in saving your work");
* Prints an error message for when there is an error loading from the save file.
System.out.println("    there hath been a failure in loading your work\n"
* Prints a welcome message for users. Has a pretty ASCII logo.
System.out.println("    Hello, \"greetings\" from your friendly neighbourhood chatbot Elster..");
System.out.println("    How can I help you today :|");
* Prints a message when the user does a task.
* @param task Task done, details needed for the function to display details.
System.out.println("    Yes boss, marked the task as done.");
* Prints a message when the user undoes a task.
* @param task Task undone, details needed for the function to display details.
System.out.println("    Interesting choice, I've marked the task as not done.");
* Prints an error message that displays when a user accesses an index that is out of bound.
System.out.println("    Ain't no such task in the middle of these woods");
* Prints an error message when the user tries to mark an already done task as done.
System.out.println("    So uh, the task is already done");
* Prints an error message when the user tries to mark an already undone task as undone.
System.out.println("    So uh, the task already is not done");
System.out.println("    Elster has trudged through the archives for your results:");
* Prints a message when the user successfully deletes a task.
public void deleteTaskMessage(TaskList taskList, Task task) {
System.out.println("    Your bidding has been done, removed:");
System.out.println("    thou now hath " + taskList.getSize() + " task to complete");
System.out.println("    thou hath no tasks to be completed");
System.out.println("    thou now hath " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks to complete");
* Prints a message when the user successfully adds a task.
public void addTaskMessage(TaskList taskList, Task task) {
System.out.println("    The task hath been added");
System.out.println("    thou now hath " + taskList.getSize() + " task to complete");
System.out.println("    thou now hath " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks to complete");
* Deadline tasks are tasks that have a deadline on top of the base task functionalities
* Factory method for a deadline task.
* Parses input string to create a deadline task with a description and a deadline.
* @param input Input from terminal to be parsed.
System.out.println("    Elster begs of you to have details for your task");
System.out.println("    Elster begs of you to have a yknow, deadline with /by");
System.out.println("    for /by, Elster requires a yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm "
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task suitable for writing to the save file.
* @return String representation of deadline formatted for file writing.
* Event tasks are tasks that have a start and end time on top of the base task functionalities
* @param description Description of the event task.
* @param start Start time of the event task.
* @param end End time of the event task.
public EventTask(String description, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) {
* Factory method for an event task.
* Parses input string to create an event with a description, a start time and an end time.
* @param input Input from terminal to be parsed.
System.out.println("    Elster \"kindly\" requests you to have details for your task");
System.out.println("    Elster \"kindly\" requests you to have a start time with /from");
System.out.println("    Elster \"kindly\" requests you to have a end time with /to");
System.out.println("    Elster \"gently\" requests a yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm format");
* Returns a string representation of the event task suitable for writing to the save file.
* @return String representation of event formatted for file writing.
* Parent class that determines base behaviour of all tasks, primarily that of having a description
* The method returns false if the task was already done.
* @return Boolean that represents whether the task was already done or not.
* The method returns false if the task was already undone.
* @return Boolean that represents whether the task was already undone or not.
* Returns a string representation of the task to be written to the save file.
* @return String representation of task suitable for writing to file.
* Todo tasks are basic tasks with regular task functionalities
* Factory method for a todo task.
* Parses input string to create a todo task with a description.
* @param input Input from terminal to be parsed.
System.out.println("    Hello hello, there seems to be something wrong with your todo "
* Returns a string representation of the todo task suitable for writing to the save file.
* @return String representation of todo task formatted for file writing.
